question: Which act signed by B.R. Ambedkar on behalf of depressed classes in September 1932 abandoned the demand for separate electorate for the depressed classes?
explanation: The agreement known as Poona Pact signed by B.R Ambedkar on behalf of the depressed classes retained the Hindu joint electorate and gave reserved seats to the depressed classes. It abandoned the demand for separate electorates for depressed classes.
